column2: A high-voltage power unit interface error at initialization.
Is the cable between the PU board and the high-voltage power unit connected properly? Is there poor contact?
Connect the cable properly. Check the high-voltage system for poor contact. Replace the highvoltage power unit.
Turn on the printer again. Replace the PU board (PRN).
A PU download data CRC check error.
After PU data (PU firmware, custom media data and LED head adjustment data) downloading, a CRC check error was detected.
Turn on the printer again and redownload the data (during usual printer operation, the downloading is not performed and the error does not occur).
A PU board flash ROM hash check error.
Turn on the printer again. Replace the PU board (PRN).
A PU board flash ROM writing error.
A flash ROM writing error was detected during the downloading of PU data. Does error reoccur?
Turn on the printer again and redownload the data (during usual printer operation, the downloading is not performed and the error does not occur). Replace the PU board (PRN).
An error in communication with the ASIC on the CU board.
Is the CU assy installed properly? Does the printer recover from the error by replacing the ARC/ SPY/SPA board.
Reinstall the assy properly. Replace the ARC/SPY/ SPA board. Replace the PU board (PRN).
Turn on the printer again. Replace the PU board (PRN).
Turn on the printer again. Replace the PU board (PRN).
Turn on the printer again. Replace the PU board (PRN).
An error in a PUCU interface.
Is the CU assy installed properly? Does the printer recover from the error by replacing the ARC/ SPY/SPA board.
Reinstall the assy properly. Replace the ARC/SPY/ SPA board. Replace the PU board (PRN).
Machine Check Exception Hardware fault detected. (Board defectiveness or Shortage of power supply volume)
Does error display reappear? (the case of a device which program ROM is attached to board directly.)
CU Program ROM Hash Check Error
Is program ROM DIMM set properly? Is error recovered by replacing program ROM DIMM? (the case of a device which program ROM is set to DIMM Slot.)
Reset ROM DIMM Replace program ROM DIMM. Replace SPA board.
CU Font ROM Hash Check Error
Is RAM DIMM set properly? Is error recovered by replacing RAM DIMM?
Reset RAM DIMM. Replace RAM DIMM. Replace ARC/SPY/SPA board.
CU Optional RAM Spec Error CU RAM DIMM is not adjust to the specification.
Is RAM DIMM genuin? Is RAM DIMM set properly? Is error recovered by replacing RAM DIMM?
Use genuine RAM DIMM. Reset RAM DIMM. Replace RAM DIMM. Replace SPA board.
Power OFF/ON Replace ARC/SPY/ SPA board.
CU Flash Error Flash ROM Error on the CU board.
Failed access to Flash set directly on CU board.

Run forced initialization of Flash.(Note that NICF/ W and Mac address is deleted. After the initialization, it is need to download NIC-F/W and/or Mac address by Maintenance utility.) In the case of before CU-F/W G1.26/X1.26, Press “+”, “-”, “CANCEL” to turn power ON. And after CU-F/W G1.27/X1.27, execute FLASH FORMAT of MAINTENANCE MENU of SYSTEM MAINTENANCE MENU. Release buttons when [FLASH FORMAT] appears, wait until [ONLINE] (2min) and Replace ARC/SPY/SPA board if symptom does not change.
CU Fan Error Abnormal CPU cooling fan on CU board.
Is CU Fan connector set properly? Is error recovered by replacing fan?
Connect properly. Replace fan. Replace SPA board.
DMA Abort Error detected in Image processor.
Engine I/F Error I/F error between PU-CU.
Is CU assembly set properly? Is error recovered by replacing ARC/SPY/SPA board?
Set properly. Replace ARC/SPY/SPA board. Replace PU board (PRN)
Video Error Fault detected when image data is extended.
[C5200/C5150/C3100] Is CU assembly set properly? Fault again? [C5400] Is CU assembly set properly?
Set properly. Replace to highperformance PC or drop resolution of data and print again. Replace ARC/SPY board Set properly. Replace SPA board.
Video Error Fault detected when image data is extended.
Engine EEPROM setting check is OK when power ON. Then detect read/ write error.
An error detected by checking, at printer`s powerom, EEPROM installation.
Is Duplex Unit of C5300/C5100 installed?
Is cable between PU board and high-voltage power unit connected properly? Is there no improperly connections?
Connect properly. Check improper connections for high-voltage. Replace high-voltage power supply.
Low-voltage power supply fan error. Low-voltage power supply temperature error.
Is fan in low-voltage power supply unit operating? Is fan connector connected properly?
Check connections for connector of fan. Replace low-voltage power supply. Replace fan motor. Replace low-voltage power supply.
Abnormal environment humidty / Not connected humidity sensor
Power OFF/ON Replace the operator panel board (PRP)
Power OFF/ON Replace the operator panel board (PRN)
Condensation in the printer was detected.
Condensation iss likely to occur in printers carried from the outside. Turn on the printer again after it is exposed to room temperature for two hours to half a day. Does the error reoccur?
Turn on the printer again after it is left alone. Replace the operator panel board (PRP)
Error detected at the fuser unit cooling fan.
Is fan connector connected properly? Does error reoccur?
Connect properly again. Replace fan motor Replace PU board (PRN)
LED head fault detected. (131 = Y, 132 = M, 133 = C, 134 = K)
Is LED head properly set? Does error reoccur?
Set properly for LED head unit. Turn power ON again. Replace LED head unit
Error detected at ID position of Up/ Down
Is ID unit set properly? Does error reoccur?
Reset ID unit. Turn power ON again. Replace ID Up/Down sensor.
ID unit fuse cannot be disconnected. (150 = Y, 151 = M, 152 = C, 153 = K)
Is ID unit setting proper? Does error reoccur?
Reset ID unit. Turn power ON again. After check connections of cable between PRT board and PU board, replace PRT board. Replace PU board (PRN)
Belt unit fuse cannot be disconnected.
Is belt unit setting proper? Does error reoccur?
Reset belt unit. Turn power ON again. Check cable connections and, replace PU board(PRN)
Fuser unit fuse cannot be disconnected.
Is fuser unit set properly? Does error reoccur?
After cleaning for fuser connector, reset. Turn power ON again. Check cable connections and replace PU board (PRN)
Error detected by toner sensor. (160 = Y, 161 = M, 162 = C, 163 = K) It does not occure in factory default setting.
Is toner cartridge setting? Is toner lock lever setting? Does error reoccur?
Set toner cartridge. Turn a lock lever of toner to a fixed position. Replace toner sensor or assembly.
Short circuit in fuser thermistor or open detected.
Turn power ON again. Replace fuser unit.
Abnormal temperature detected by fuser thermistor (high-temp or low temp.)
Turn power ON again. Replace fuser unit.
Short circuit in back up roller thermistor detected (at high temperature).
Turn power ON again. Replace fuser unit.
Open of back up roller thermistor detected (at low temperature).
Turn power ON again. Replace fuser unit.
Abnormal (high) temperature of back up roller thermistor detected.
Turn power ON again. Replace fuser unit.
Option unit I/F error. (181 = Duplex Unit, 182 = Option Tray)
Turn power ON again. After checking connection parts of connector, replace option unit.
Turn power ON again. Add option RAM DIMM.
Error occurered while writing over the PU firmware.
Turn the printer OFF/ ON, and retry to download the PU firmware again. (Usually, the procedure (PU firmware download) which isn’t done, so this is not occur.)
Power off/on 203:Error 204:Error 207:Error 208:Error 210:Error ~ 214:Error F0C:Error F0D:Error(C5400 only) FFE:Error(C5400 only) FFF:Error
An error was detected of the CU program. (203~214 is not occure in usual operating.)
Reinstall the CU board. Is the error message displayed again?
After turn power OFF, check connections between CU board and PU board. Then turn power ON again.
Downloading Media Table to PU has failure.(Related to Custom Media Type)
Turn the printer OFF/ ON, and retry to download the PU firmware, again. (Usually, the procedure isn’t done, so this is not occur.)
False setting of a record medium detected by a print statistics.
Take off the HDD or replaced?
Short or open in belt thermistor detected.
Is belt thermistor cable setting proper? Does error reoccur?
Connect cable set properly again. Turn power ON again. Replace belt thermistor.
Abnormal temperature detected by belt thermistor (high-temp or low temp.)
Is belt thermistor cable setting proper? Does error reoccur?
Connect cable set properly again. Turn power ON again. Replace belt thermistor and leave aside for 30 min. Then turn power ON again.
An open error of frame thermistor (defective thermistor or improper connection) detected.
Turn power ON again. Replace the fuser unit.
A short circuit error of frame thermistor (defective improper) detected.
Turn power ON again. Replace the fuser unit.
A high temperature error (over 150°C) of frame thermistor detected.
Turn power ON again. Replace the fuser unit.
A low temperature error (below [environmental temperature minus 10]°C) of frame thermistor detected.
Turn power ON again. Replace the fuser unit.
Power off/on 203:Error 204:Error 207:Error 208:Error 210:Error ~ 214:Error F0C:Error F0D:Error(C5400 only) FFE:Error(C5400 only) FFF:Error
An error was detected of the CU program. (203~214 is not occure in usual operating.)
Reinstall the CU board. Is the error message displayed again?
After turn power OFF, check connections between CU board and PU board. Then turn power ON again.
